meta.title: Preparation & Application
meta.subtitle: From powder to drink: How to prepare Kava correctly to achieve maximum effect and the best taste.

grundlagen.intro: Kavalactones are not water-soluble, but fat-soluble. They mechanically adhere to the starch particles of the root.
grundlagen.text: The goal of any preparation is therefore to release these particles from the plant fibers through mechanical force (kneading, mixing) and to emulsify them in water. A pure "tea preparation" (just pouring hot water) does not work effectively with Kava!

traditionell.title: Traditional Method (Kneading)
traditionell.intro: This is the best method for maximum potency and an authentic experience.
materials: A filter bag (nut milk bag, 75-100 microns)
A bowl of warm (not boiling!) water
Optional: A splash of milk or coconut milk (fat helps with extraction)
instructions: Place the powder in the filter bag (about 30-40g per 500ml of water).
Submerge the bag in the water and let it soak briefly.
Knead and Squeeze: Knead the bag vigorously underwater for 10-15 minutes. Squeeze it out repeatedly. The water should turn milky-brown ("Grog").
Squeeze the bag one last time firmly.
Serve the Kava in bowls (Shells). Drink quickly ("Chug"), do not sip!

blender.title: Blender Method
blender.intro: Faster and often stronger, but the taste can be somewhat more bitter as more plant materials are crushed.
instructions: Add water, Kava powder, and a teaspoon of oil/fat to a stand mixer.
Pour the liquid through a filter bag or fine sieve into a bowl.
Press the plant residues well in the filter.

shaker.title: Shaker Method (Aluball)
shaker.intro: The most modern and fastest method, ideal for on-the-go.
shaker.text: Special shaker bottles with a ball (Aluball) that contains a metal sieve are used.
instructions: Fill the sieve ball with Kava.
Insert the ball and shake vigorously for 1-2 minutes.
shaker.note: Note: This method is often slightly less potent than traditional kneading, but very convenient.

instant.title: Instant & Micronized
instant.intro: For those who want no effort at all.

items.name: Instant Kava
items.description: Dehydrated "Green Kava Juice". Very potent, very expensive, dissolves instantly in water. The "royal class".

items.name: Micronized Kava
items.description: Extremely finely ground root powder, with the coarse fibers removed. It is simply consumed as is. It may cause nausea in sensitive stomachs more than filtered Kava.

alert.title: The Golden Rule
alert.text: Always drink Kava on an empty stomach (at least 3-4 hours after the last meal). Otherwise, the effect is significantly weaker!

tips.name: Reverse Tolerance
tips.text: Many people feel little the first time. The body needs to "get used to" the Kavalactones. Drink it for a few days in a row.

tips.name: The "Chaser"
tips.text: Kava tastes earthy and bitter. Keep a piece of fruit (pineapple, orange) ready to bite into right after drinking.

tips.name: Source of Fat
tips.text: Eat a small, fatty meal (e.g., pizza, curry) after the Kava session. This can trigger a second wave of effect.
